ReportText: EXAM: CHEST RADIOGRAPHY EXAM DATE: 05/14/2020 10:17 AM. CLINICAL HISTORY: Cough, fever. COMPARISON: None. TECHNIQUE: 2 views. FINDINGS: Lungs/Pleura: There are mild bilateral streaky perihilar opacities and bronchial cuffing. No focal segmental or lobar consolidation evident. No pleural effusion. No pneumothorax. Normal volumes. Mediastinum: Heart and mediastinal contours are unremarkable. Other: No acute osseous abnormality. IMPRESSION: Mild bilateral streaky perihilar opacities and bronchial cuffing may be seen in the setting of viral infection or reactive airway disease. No focal segmental or lobar consolidation to suggest pneumonia.
